website_summaries.verdict: An inexpensive mid-range chew toy that will survive dedicated chewers within its weight range, while cleaning their teeth at the same time.
pros: Low cost toy with polyurethane nubs that rub plaque from teeth
Durable nylon “bone” comes in many color variants
Available in sizes extra small through extra large
cons: Intended for dogs between 20 and 50 pounds

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy. Very dangerous to dogs.
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst toy. The “durable” outter shell was easily chewed into “big” pieces. Then because those pieces smelled like the chewy inner, the dogs ate them. So now you have plastic pieces inside of your dogs stomach. They were sharp and pointy. That’s not going to feel real good coming out. The dogs gums were bleeding all over. How you can sell this as a dog “toy/chewy” is beyond me. Don’t buy it. Horrible product for your dog to enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: J. R. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Could have been a disaster. Rubber/Plastic lodged in dogs throat
customer_reviews.text: The "bone" is made out of plastic/rubber. My 35lb dog managed to rip off a small piece of the plastic and it ended up lodged in her throat. She was coughing/gagging for a few minutes before I could pull it out. Luckily I was home at the time. I IMMEDIATELY threw the toy away. Never again.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal A.

customer_reviews.title: DANGEROUS, please don't buy!
customer_reviews.text: Just like everyone said, my dog ended up eating a bunch of plastic. She was chewing on it for awhile and I kept checking on her and it was fine, so I didn't worry much. 30 minutes later I go over and she's eaten HALF of the green plastic! She's not a tough chewer at all so this product has to be incredibly week. After reading some reviews about dogs requiring surgery, I'm horrified. This shouldn't be able to stay on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Anagnoston

customer_reviews.title: Not too small at all!
customer_reviews.text: Based on some reviews we were not sure our puppy was gonna like this bone and being that they were labeled "extra small" we thought they'd be super tiny but in reality they're perfect for small to medium sized dogs. Our 3 month old chiwinnie puppy absolutely loved these. The deal is great too. Can't go wrong with 2 bucks and change as an add on item. We bought 3 and will be getting more on our next order.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy & Evan

customer_reviews.title: Not for aggressive chewers!
customer_reviews.text: Both my dogs chewed this up in a matter of minutes. One of them (a year old pit) actually ate some of the pieces of plastic that came off. I'm keeping a close eye on her, because the pieces of chewed plastic are very sharp and could hurt coming out. The other dog is a moderate chewer, and she shredded it as well. They definitely enjoyed it, but I had to take them away because of the plastic shavings. I wouldn't recommend this for any but the most gently chewers.
customer_reviews.author: jr

customer_reviews.title: Hartz Chew 'n Clean Bounce & Bite Dog Toy - Let Down
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Hartz dog chew toy for our 3 year old black Lab. We had the other Chew'n Clean toy (looks like a bone) that is almost used up, and he still plays with it. I thought the Bounce & Bite dog toy would be different for him and last just as long. Within 10 minutes he destroyed the toys and broke it in half. This product was a letdown, I will get the other one again and not waste my money on this toy. The green toy he's had for over a month, the yellow/blue one he destroyed in 10 min.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy Ferraro

customer_reviews.title: We just got a dog and learned that he liked to chew on things
customer_reviews.text: We just got a dog and learned that he liked to chew on things. Not excessively, but he definitely ruined my kids markers when he found them. I wanted to get him a chew toy that would have a secondary purpose; dental health. So I was excited to find these Hertz brand Chew N' Clean Duo bones. I unwrapped it as the dog watched, his tail wagging, handed it to him, and nothing. He just walked away. My kids followed him with the bone trying to get him to smell it and stick it in his mouth. Nothing. The dog doesn't like this thing. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: TheMrs.R

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous for your dog!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my 3 dogs. The idea of an edible treat inside cheap plastic is NOT a good one. Within minutes, my two larger dogs had destroyed the plastic to get to the dog treat. It broke off in large sharp shards, so I immediately picked it up. I sent back and received a refund without issue. This could have been quite dangerous and caused either a choking incident, or worse, an intestinal blockage or laceration. Hartz products are not what they used to be and most of them are made in China. Beware before you give this to your dog. Bully sticks, yacky sticks or non-rawhide chews are a much better option, even if more expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Julsie

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT GIVE THESE TO YOUR DOG
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my older blue heelers & noticed within 10 minutes they HAVE to eat the "toy" plastic liner just to get to the inside. There is NO WAY for a dog to get to the treat inside without consuming the plastic first. I threw them away immediately because I in no way see at all how safe it is to let my dogs chew on enidible hard potentially toxic made in China plastic!!! Then I read the negative reviews CHOKING & VOMITING too wow... Don't get why these got any good reviews at all.
customer_reviews.author: Marnee Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Danger Danger Danger
customer_reviews.text: We have a 30lb labradoodle pup that easily bit through this like a dog treat. See the attached picture. Later in the evening, she was gaging and coughing, clearly in distress. Around bedtime, she began throwing up little bits and pieces of this product, along with food and stomach bile. This is certainly not a "chew toy" nor is it edible. Poor thing. We hope we don't have to bring her to the vet but we are keeping a close eye on her this morning.
customer_reviews.author: MartinQ

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: This toy is so cheap that even my 6 lb shihtzu was able to chew the plastic off and then 2 of my dogs threw up for a day, tiny plastic pieces. Waste of money and potentially harmful, do not buy!
customer_reviews.author: silegirl

customer_reviews.title: Good for my dogs - maybe not yours
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love these!! I have four very small dogs (each under 10 pounds) so I get them these in the smallest size. These have listed about two weeks between four dogs so I’m very happy with it. They LOVE these little bones. If you have a dog that destroys toys / chews through everything these might not be the best - half of the treat is plastic. My dogs aren’t destructive when it comes to toys and only chew the actual treat portion of the toy but I could see how it could be an issue for others. For me & my small dogs- these are perfect!! Will be buying again
customer_reviews.author: Melissa M

customer_reviews.title: Great chews for tough jaws
customer_reviews.text: I have one 20lb terrier and one 60lb retriever who love these. They only have them during kennel "rest" time. They are good for their teeth and gums and are nearly impossible to destroy. Dropped one star because the little dimples on the "bones" do make a mess everywhere but I don't worry about ingestion because they are so tiny, no bigger than a grain of rice. Vets are beginning to say how damaging and bad for digestion rawhide chews are for dogs, so I feel better giving mine this kind and it keeps them occupied all through "rest" time. They don't eat them, just enjoy the chewing. When they get yucky looking, I replace them with new.
customer_reviews.author: Y. Adair Smith

customer_reviews.title: Bulldog Approved...
customer_reviews.text: These are the best chewy bones I have ever purchased. My bulldogs normally destroy toys and chewy toys in a matter of days!! These last up to 6 months, I've had some last a year. My French Bulldog Sadie Bear loves them. I've seen her destroy a rubber tire toy in one day, but not this bone! We call it her "cookie" and once it get's down to what I feel is an unsafe or pointy size, I buy another. Best part is, it keeps her teeth clean and keeps her away from my shoes lol.. A definite must when you have dogs that like to chew constantly... Highly recommended...
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Small not made for big dogs
customer_reviews.text: One star for dog loves the taste and one star for fast delivery. It was small and took 2 chops to break, and 5 min to about finish. And our dog isn't a crazy chewer she doesn't destroy toys.
customer_reviews.author: Kmieciak.A

customer_reviews.title: Plastic Plastic Everywhere
customer_reviews.text: The outer toy IS plastic, and if your dogs teeth are sharp enough, they could probably break off chunks. Our little mini doxy seems to like it, even though I bought the large bone by mistake. However, even after just one morning, I can see that she's going to destroy this thing inside of 48 hours, so it's not going to last (not that any chew toy does). Lastly, the packaging has more than enough plastic, too. Plastic package, plastic-coated cardboard (that took a scissor to open). Just no. This is 2020. If companies aren't going to make more practical packaging, then I'm out; and I definitely would not purchase this product again.
customer_reviews.author: BarbaraK

customer_reviews.title: My GSD loves it.
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this toy. She has others but think she likes the size or feel of this one because she chooses it 70% of the time. Have already had to replace twice she uses it so much. It lasts my GSD for 3-4 weeks but she only has access for a few hours a day. She does not touch the little nubs in center only bites knobby ends and flattens them out. Think she is trying to make a shiv to hamstring me.
customer_reviews.author: Ernie A

customer_reviews.title: I like the concept, not durable enough for our dog.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the idea of this chew and we've bought Hart products before for our lab/shepherd mix (70 lbs, normal to moderate chewer) and he's done great with them. However, I had to throw this one out within an hour of giving it to him because he was literally breaking it into small pieces and almost choked on one. Maybe would be better for small breed dogs...Definitely don't recommend for larger ones.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Puking up plastic
customer_reviews.text: So much for the outter casing being "durable." My dogs (even the non-chewers) have demolished these, case and all (I bought 3). One of my pups aas sick all night, puking up pieces of plastic. The price is ridiculous, too. I can get a treat that's fully edible for less than this, and not have to worry about my dogs choking on the pieces. The only reason I'm giving it 2 stars is because my dogs seem to like them, and the shipping was quick. I will not be buying these again.
customer_reviews.author: cnstewart1182

customer_reviews.title: Gave my pup diarrhea. $120 dog chew after vet bill!!!
customer_reviews.text: Usually I buy all natural chewys and bones. My almost one year old Aussie pup loves to chew my kids plastic toys so I thought this may be a good alternative chewy for her. She was very excited for this, liked the flavor and chewed it constantly for about 36 hours. Bits of plastic have come off, small ones, but I think it was enough to give her watery diarrhea & end up at the vet with intestinal issues. This ended up being a $120 chewy after vet and meds. I’m going back to natural products like bones, ears, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Jen P

customer_reviews.title: A Power Chewer's Value Bone
customer_reviews.text: My dog is definitely a power chewer. None of the toys/bones on the market can withstand him except nylon bones. These bones can last a couple months - most of the time. These bones last just as long as the big-name brand nylon bones, but are half to 2/3rd cheaper. There are times when he can render a nylon bone unsafe within a few days, but that can be said for the big-name brand bones as well. The difference is, if I have to toss out a bone after a few days, I'd much rather toss a $4 bone than a $10+ bone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Large size is best for most dogs!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! I bought a smaller size for my puppy, but my older dog keeps stealing it, so I bought a bunch of large ones to put in crates and dog beds around the house. I love the quiet when my dogs are sitting chewing. Only thing I don’t like is the chewed end gets pokey bits that collects lint and string and any fur that I pick out fo avoid my dogs swallowing. But any hard chews seem to do this, so it’s not that concern to me. If you have a nervous dog, or are crate training, I recommend these bones for your dog, they seem to really like them.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Cat

customer_reviews.title: Price gauge in one month
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves these! They last a long time. I have a 70 pound American Bulldog mix puppy and this is one one of the only things he can’t destroy. I’m giving a 3 instead of a 5, bc I bought this on March 6,2020 for $1.86 each. Now it’s over $5 each as of April 3, 2020 after spread of Covid 19 has gotten worse. Price gauging much? It is disgusting when companies take advantage of consumers who already have a tight budget bc of business closures and layoffs from the pandemic. You should be ashamed of your business practices!!!
customer_reviews.author: Liz D

customer_reviews.title: Stinky and middle is to small
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my 2 dogs because they love chew toys/ treats. They enjoyed them the first day but don't seem to like what's left of them. The middle is impossible for them to get out of the plastic. I know it's supposed to keep them busy but they lost interest in it because it was so difficult. Probably won't buy again. They have a bad odor also
customer_reviews.author: Online shopping lover

customer_reviews.title: Don’t recommend it
customer_reviews.text: Don’t like this product at all my dog doesn’t even go near it or bothers to chew on it doesn’t matter if it has the bacon smell and won’t even look at it I thought it was going to be all rubber that probably would’ve made a change but the only rubber part it’s the bottom and top panfish color but the whole white bone part is hard Plastic I have a Chihuahua I’m pretty sure it would break my dogs teeth if it was to chew on the whole thing I don’t recommend does not satisfy at all
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: My dog destroyed it in LITERALLY less than 10 min
customer_reviews.text: This is the WORST dog chew toy I have ever bought and Im a dog behaviorist who has worked with thousands of dogs so that's a lot of toys. If you have a dog that chews, dont get this. They mix in peanut butter like substance but its so hard the dog cant differentiate between what they can eat the the plastic. This was in pieces within 10 minutes. Fortunately my dogs dont eat plastic, so it was all on the floor. But most of the dogs I work with would have injected the plastic. Unless your dog is the lightest chewer in the world, id get something else.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Please read before buying
customer_reviews.text: At first I was really excited to give these treats to my two kids (dogs) but when I received them we noticed the material was hard plastic. I thought it was way too hard for my dogs to chew on so I decided to look up more reviews, I didn’t like what I read because most people had the plastic tear off and their dogs sallowed it. Dogs can tear yo their stomach when swallowing such items, I ended up returning mine. I rated them a 3 because emu dogs liked them but they are not safe.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Doggies best chewing friend!
customer_reviews.text: I have a larger one of these for a medium sized doggy and then I wanted a second and smaller one for my smaller doggy.......well who has attached themselves to this one?! The medium doggy. That's ok! They're happy either way. I think it's the "flavor" she extra loves. Either way, I plan on getting a second because they LOVE these!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda & Jen

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves these chew bones
customer_reviews.text: He spends a lot of time with it but takes a while before I'd consider it to chewed up for him to continue so I always buy two or three so he's never without. I found after Christmas is a good time to buy as the price drops as sellers clean out their stock. I think 3 will last a year or more. He's been chewing the current one going on 4 months and thats about time to switch it out with a new one as the ends get kinda ragged after a few months.
customer_reviews.author: justdave

customer_reviews.title: These little chews are a favorite of my little Maltese
customer_reviews.text: These little chews are a favorite of my little Maltese. Even though he's no longer teething, he loves the flavor and chews on these, which makes me happy that he's not eating his other toys. The inside flavor stuff doesn't leave little flakes all over like some other types of dog chewies and the plastic outside withstands even persistent little teeth without chipping and coming apart. I've already made another order, it's cheaper than replacing shoes, belts and other things my little one doesn't need to be destroying. These things are great!
customer_reviews.author: Tam

customer_reviews.title: not safe
customer_reviews.text: I would rate this product less than a star if i could.the edible part of this is not detachable.and the outer part is plastic which is NOT edible.I have a hound the size recomended and my guy ate the whole thing.he devoured half before I noticed.Half of what he ate he threw up and the rest was stuck in his bowls.which required Emergency visit to the vet.thankfully he is ok .But not without cost.This product should not be on the market .They can be fatel to you pet.
customer_reviews.author: kathleen barnes

customer_reviews.title: Perfect teething bone for a puppy
customer_reviews.text: My 3 month old pomeranian is teething and this really keeps her mouth busy. I think she likes the nubby texture and bacon flavor. I also put it in the freezer to get it cold and then give it to her. I think it makes her gums feel better
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Valtierra

customer_reviews.title: Loses scent quickly
customer_reviews.text: So, the only reason I docked it a star is because it lots the scent rather quickly after getting out of the package. Other than that, we have had this toy for about a year and a half and it is still intact. He doesn't play with it as often unless he is in a chewing mood, but he did play with it quite a bit in the beginning. He will take it when offered to him when he seems like he wants to keep himself busy chewing on something.
customer_reviews.author: Addicted Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Seems like quality has diminished a bit
customer_reviews.text: Gave it 3 stars, but acknowledging my dog may be a more aggressive chewer than I realize. Have purchased these for all our dogs for many years. This time I purchased a larger one, thinking it would last even longer than usual - especially because usually the smaller dog gnaws on it most. But within just a few days most of the “nubs” had been chewed off, and I’m finding them all over the house. Doesn’t seem as durable as they were in the past.
customer_reviews.author: GV

customer_reviews.title: My Goldendoodle Gives 5 Stars!
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this bone! The first " Chew" toy he actually chews on! We needed something he would chew on to help keep the plague build up off his teeth. This was the first chew toy I found that he loves and chews on every day! I will be buying another one soon. He has chewed one end up so that it is half gone already and he has only had it about 6 -8 weeks I think. I would recommend this to all dog mamas. ( He is about 70 lbs. )
customer_reviews.author: Kari H.

customer_reviews.title: Never again
customer_reviews.text: My dog loved this bone and at first I thought it was amazing that it was keeping her occupied. Then I noticed all the plastic that she was eating. This cannot be good for dogs. The inside was good but if they have to chew through plastic to get to it what’s the point? Will not buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Erin P

customer_reviews.title: Good for carpeted area or outside
customer_reviews.text: My dog does really enjoy this toy however it's a nightmare to have inside the house. Unfortunately there's no carpeting in our home (all hardwood and tile) so it didn't take long for him to drive us crazy with all the noise he made playing with this toy by throwing it around, in addition to being worried he would do some damage with it since it's a pretty solid bone. I would suggest this to people who wouldn't be bothered by the loud noises in a hard floor environment; I would suggest it if you have carpeting or plan to keep this toy outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: She loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My puppy absolutely loves this! Gave it to her for Christmas and she has been wagging her tail and carrying it around like it’s the greatest thing ever. She seems to love the flavor. And I love that it’s good for her too!
customer_reviews.author: stephie

customer_reviews.title: Finally one my dog likes.
customer_reviews.text: WE have two dogs, one a chewer, one not. The chewer loves this. The nonchewer used to wait for the chewer to soften a rawhide before he would take it and chew a little. Now, we have two and both are being chewed a lot by both dogs. The "plastic" ends get chewed a lot too. When they start to get bits off we take them. Takes about a month. Would be nice if we could refill the centers.
customer_reviews.author: MLR

customer_reviews.title: Great discovery!
customer_reviews.text: Love these!! My dog loves these!! They last long and keep his attention. They last really long because the edible parts and the plastic parts are intertwined so he has to chew through both which slows him way down. Because there's actual edible parts in there he chews it way longer than any other bone ever. They are very reasonably priced. I just discovered these and will be buying many more
customer_reviews.author: Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Seems safer for my dog
customer_reviews.text: We like these over the other "nylon" and rubber bones because he can't easily break off chunks of it and swallow hole. Had a big problem with large pieces of nylon passing through the dog. Worried that one might not make it and we REALLY don't want that vet bill. The plastic "shell" on these keeps the tasty treat pretty much intact and he can only get tiny pieces at a time, but still tastes the flavor.
customer_reviews.author: PCJ

customer_reviews.title: Unsafe
customer_reviews.text: These are terrible! We have a chiweenie ( size reference ) that we bought these for and she chewed off dime size bits of the plastic. Not safe. We originally thought she may have eaten something outside, but after gagging and coughing up foam, she finally was able to cough up a piece. Hartz has been around for YEARS. Disappointed that they would produce something that can be this unsafe
customer_reviews.author: amiee saleh

customer_reviews.title: These are my dogs favorite chew bones
customer_reviews.text: These are my dogs favorite chew bones. At her last vet visit I was asked if I brushed her teeth. I felt guilty when I said no, she just uses these chew bones. The vet said whatever you are using keep it up. I do not buy any other chew bones for her.
customer_reviews.author: Connie Filben

customer_reviews.title: MY dogs were eating plastic!
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 large (100+lb) dogs. They chewed the ends of these and were ingesting plastic! NOT GOOD FOR YOUR DOGS! Thank goodness I got them away from them! By the 2nd day of having these they had the ends chewed and I noticed small pieces of plastic where they were chewing them. This was not just a small amount gone either, but the "treat" center was all in tact still!
customer_reviews.author: kstacy

customer_reviews.title: Not sure about this one
customer_reviews.text: My dog usually bites only one side of the bone lol. I did notice though that very quickly the bone started getting rough on the edge and pointy. My dog eventually had bloody gums and so I decided to throw it away. It didn't last as long as other toys I have purchased in the past. If you want to give your dog something to play with every once in a while then this one should work just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley Cruz

customer_reviews.title: The best dog chew bone hands down!
customer_reviews.text: Our dogs love these and they last longer than a regular bone or nylabone. The plastic part is very thick so my super chewers who chew through everything have never chewed through one of these. They love the edible center and because of the way it's shaped? It takes a long time for them to get it all out. Once it's finally gone, I still use the plastic part and spread peanut butter in it. I would definitely recommend theses!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for  teething pups.
customer_reviews.text: My 4 month old dachshund is teething like crazy. He has been chewing on our furniture and destroying all his plush toys. This teething ring is such a hit! He’s been playing with it non stop. It has different textures to help his teeth it’s also not too hard or too soft. So far it has held up to his chewing. It is also the perfect size not too big or too small. Win win. I recommend! Wish I could add pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a favorite of my mini-pin
customer_reviews.text: This is a favorite of my mini-pin. The product my vet recommended did not keep his tarter in check, but he love to chew on these and they keep his teeth real clean. This is a regular reorder for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Spencer loves these!
customer_reviews.text: Our 1-1/2 year old terrier loves these chew toys! He gets the inside empty in a day or two but chews the rest until I have to throw it out. I would say it lasts him about 3 weeks (I’d give him 3 hrs with a stuffed toy of any kind!). As any owner knows, most pet toys are expensive but these are reasonably priced for all the time he’s occupied with them!
customer_reviews.author: rongr

customer_reviews.title: WARNING! My dog ended up throwing up large chunks of green plastic.
customer_reviews.text: WARNING! My dog ended up throwing up large chunks of green plastic. The dog is supposed to chew on the toy and knock out pieces of the edible part without breaking off pieces of the non-edible green plastic, but that isn't what happened. I would not consider my dog an aggressive chewer but she was able to destroy this toy quickly and ended up eating non-edible parts with the edible parts. I would not recommend this toy!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Steinbach

customer_reviews.title: Too hard, too heavy, and my puppy is disinterested.
customer_reviews.text: My puppy is an avid chewer, so when I saw this on special I thought I’d try it. My dog doesn’t care a out this AT ALL. He will literally chew on anything, but not this. He is about thirty pounds. And this thing is HEAVY. I would say if you have a sixty pound dog it may be okay, but it is too heavy for medium sized dogs. It is also very very hard. I imagine that makes it more durable but it is too hard for him to even try to chew. I incorrectly assumed it would be softer.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlynn

customer_reviews.title: Both my dogs loves these. I get both large ...
customer_reviews.text: Both my dogs loves these. I get both large and medium. They last until I decide they've chewed on them long enough to purchase more. Both dogs constantly go to these even without being able to get to all the edible center. Only con is that they can't get all of the edible center before I have to toss them. They last for my dogs a long time. I have a medium pit/lab mix and a larger lab/shep. mix.
customer_reviews.author: Julie P

customer_reviews.title: We have a 4month old Labrador and she loves these ...
customer_reviews.text: We have a 4month old Labrador and she loves these bones. I put them in the freezer and give her one at night to chew on. She doesn't seem to be interested in them after she chews the treat off the ends. She won't chew on it if it only has treat in the center so I just keep buying more. I figure it's cheaper to buy 2 a week or more than to replace the couch.
customer_reviews.author: Elle Daly

customer_reviews.title: Oops - breaks into smaller pieces
customer_reviews.text: Someone gave one of these to my German Shepherd. He loved it. I noticed the other day that he had broken a piece off of it from one end. A small enough piece to swallow! I tossed the thing and cancelled an order I had made for more. I've paid vets to get stuff out of dog's stomachs and it is in the thousands$$$ !
customer_reviews.author: SilverGhost

customer_reviews.title: WORST DOG TOY EVER
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to my dog. I thought he was just enjoying getting the treats out. Next thing I know he had the two balls at the end only. He ate all the blue plastic and now I’m concerned. It didn’t take him long either and now I’m going to have to watch him like a hawk and hope I don’t need to take him to the ER.
customer_reviews.author: C W

customer_reviews.title: Our dog showed a great interest in the product
customer_reviews.text: Our dog showed a great interest in the product! It's very convenient to hold for a pet and the smell is strong enough to keep a dog interested for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Elena Serbina

customer_reviews.title: Choking hazard!!!
customer_reviews.text: My dog chewed this up in a matter of minutes. He actually ate some of the pieces of plastic that came off before I could get it from him. I'm keeping a close eye on him to make sure he's ok. I IMMEDIATELY threw this toy away. This product was a big letdown and I will never buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: My 16-lb. Pup loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My pup LOVES these bones! Shes 16 lbs and we prefer the small size, but the medium works too. I ordered the medium this time because it was cheaper than the small. She's a pretty heavy chewer, but these bones last forever! We only exchange it out every 4-5 months because it starts to get gross and it really hurts when you step on it by mistake.
customer_reviews.author: srh5213

customer_reviews.title: great durability,  great reward.
customer_reviews.text: I love these bones because they make your dog have to work towards the reward. My dog is a mini dachsund and he loves these type of treats/toys. Great for rewarding your little dog. Cannot beat this price either. I will be buying again in future when the current one's are wore down. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jason D.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Puppy simply does not like it
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping it would taste or smell like bacon but our puppy simply doesn't like it. I'm not certain of the durability or longevity because she leaves it alone and instead tries to chew on our clothing and shoes. I am disappointed.if I put it in her mouth when she is chewing something she should not be, she simply drops it..
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Seems nice my girl likes it
customer_reviews.text: My dog is 2 pounds the label says up to 10 pounds, I was/ still am worried she may chew the soft rubber blue pieces off. I could see a dog any bigger than her being able to get them off. Otherwise she seems to like it. It is a little harder than I imagined it to be with it being called a twisty bone.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: A Yorkie Favorite Treat!
customer_reviews.text: My three Yorkies love, love, love these! They will spend hours chewing to get out what, to them, must be a really tasty treat. The treats don’t last long here, but my puppies do not like the larger version with the plastic nubs in between for whatever reason. Have used these for years and they don’t stain, pose a choking risk, or make our fur babies sick, so I will continue to buy these in bulk!
customer_reviews.author: HurricaneSandy

customer_reviews.title: Not for strong “chewers”
customer_reviews.text: Great for my small dog. My friend has a lab, however, and he was able to chew it into pieces and I had to quickly take it away from him and throw the plastic bits away. I had to throw it away because it was too sharp, so I ordered another one for my pup...she loves them and cant break them (she is also only 4 lbs fully grown).
customer_reviews.author: Jenna H. Mead

customer_reviews.title: Chewed on but not showing wear
customer_reviews.text: My teething puppy likes this toy. She walks around with it hanging out her mouth like a white cigar. Although she chews on this regularly it still looks like it did right out of package. Thus I would say it is very durable. I can not smell any scent but it appears to have a dog detectable scent.
customer_reviews.author: Bee Cool Travel

customer_reviews.title: Caution- Smells Like Tires
customer_reviews.text: This chew toy smelled like tires right out of the package. I washed it, and it still smelled of tire rubber. I gave it to my cockapoo puppy and she chewed on the edible part for a short time, and then walked away. I’m returning this for the strong tire smell. I’m sure it’s not healthy. Hartz- where are you manufacturing this stuff?
customer_reviews.author: hiawathamom

customer_reviews.title: Some dogs may like these
customer_reviews.text: My dog does not like these. The flavor is inside of the weaved in the bone and she likes these flavors, but not this bone (maybe they should use peanut butter flavor). She tried to chew this a couple of times and after she was done I was picking up the stuff inside the plastic. I have gone back to the dental chew.
customer_reviews.author: MIMI

customer_reviews.title: Fun dog chew toy when your pet is bored
customer_reviews.text: My dog just loves it he already chew away both ends of the bone, and I believe is because the taste of the bacon they use into it. It’s safe because the dog does not eats it. It’s a little messy when he chews off pieces of it but I vacuum it up and it’s good for their teeth strengthening also.
customer_reviews.author: Eva Pop

customer_reviews.title: Not Puppy Friendly
customer_reviews.text: My 6 mo med/large dog (husky heeler mix) liked this for about 30 Seconds. I didn’t realize there was going to be plastic covering 2/3 of it. How is the dog supposed to chew it?!? Well, she got the 1/3 that she could reach of one of them and wouldn’t even touch the other one. Maybe if you have a heavy licker it would be good- they can lick it like an ever lasting gob stopper ;-D
customer_reviews.author: H. C. Phillips

customer_reviews.title: little interest from my pup
customer_reviews.text: my dog only occasionally chews on this and when he does, it’s only for a couple mins before he becomes disinterested again, i think he’d like it more if it was meat scented on the plus side, he’s an aggressive chewer and hasn’t destroyed it so maybe it’s durable or maybe it’s just because he doesn’t play with it that much
customer_reviews.author: Lisa W

customer_reviews.title: NOT EDIBLE EASY TO CHEW OFF PIECES!!
customer_reviews.text: I am sending these back as my little 5 pound dogs can chew pieces off of these bones and swallow the pieces and they are NOT edible and will cause an obstruction which could lead to having to have costly surgery!! so I am sending these back.. This is my honest.opinion so BEWARE!!
customer_reviews.author: DD

customer_reviews.title: Not sure why...
customer_reviews.text: It looks and smells like it promised. I think it would probably be better for a puppy or a dog who is a chewer. Our dogs (age6) took one sniff and walked away. We put them in their toy basket but they have not touched them again. Update Took it to our daughter's new puppy. He LOVES it!
customer_reviews.author: Ms.Adams

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this product
customer_reviews.text: My 5 lb Chihuahua destroyed this toy. Literally gnawed it to bits in a few days. I picked the pieces up as they turned up on our den floor. She also tried to EAT this toy. I have been buying toys from Hartz for 50 plus years and have never had such a hunk of junk toy. RobbieAnn
customer_reviews.author: Robbie R. Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: For my aggressive chewer!
customer_reviews.text: I have a pitbull/German shepherd cross who is an aggressive chewer. She loves these bones. It takes her some time to get through them, probably a few weeks. They don't make much of a mess either which is a plus. The bacon scent seems to peak her interest too. She knows they are for her and won't chew on other items.
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: great for a dog that chews on everything
customer_reviews.text: the headline says it all. these bars last a long time. My pomeranian chews A LOT. I just interest him in the bar to distract him from my shoes or whatever, and he can settle down for a long chew. I sometimes renew the bars by soaking in chicken broth. They last quite a while. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: HikerBob

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: I’m sorry but this is a TERRIBLE product! The idea is great, it’s attractive. However, my dogs thought that the WHOLE thing was edible and started chewing up the plastic. I had to throw them away as quick as possible so they wouldn’t swallow the hard plastic Will not be ordering again!
customer_reviews.author: Ebullient

customer_reviews.title: Not as durable as i thought???
customer_reviews.text: I didnt like this much i gave it to my pup and she had it torn up wirhin an hour i dont know if i had gotten a defective one or if it wasnt as durable as i had thought i dont want to give this a "bad" review because sometimes defects happen i just personally choose not to order this one again
customer_reviews.author: b pryor

customer_reviews.title: Longlasting Flavor and Durability
customer_reviews.text: This product is outstanding in its length of wear and flavor. Dogs will keep chewing it because of its long lasting flavor and durability. Lasted two weeks!
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Plastic chew
customer_reviews.text: My dog sniffs at this then walks away - every single time. After more than a month of this and preferring to chew on antlers, I gave it to someone else. Their dog chewed on it for about a day then refused to pick it up. I don't smell anything besides plastic. I didn't try to taste it, however, so I can't speak to the flavor. It's not made from digestible ingredients so we wont' be purchasing another one.
customer_reviews.author: KaseyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: My 2 Pitties LOVE these
customer_reviews.text: I have a full pitt and a half pit half lab. They LOVE to chew, they love toys! These must have a fantastic smell and feel. They love love love these! Both are big dogs with strong jaws. It takes them a good two week to destroy them. That is a huge recommendation!
customer_reviews.author: Staci

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I thought I found the perfect bone. It helped a lot with his breath, breaking down the plaque on his back teeth. Not even a month and he was already able to chew through it. Now my pup is sad that I took it away from him. Hoping to find a more lasting sturdy bone just like it. I had another bone that I got at the dollar store and he has had it for 2 years and it still is strong and sturdy. It just doesn’t have the ridges.
customer_reviews.author: RD

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves it!
customer_reviews.text: The Amazon package just arrived, literally. I open these dental bones up and being my dog is only 10 lb gave him the smaller of the two. He looked at it, sniffed it, took it and is chewing his little heart out. I say by the look on his face these are winners!
customer_reviews.author: kj

customer_reviews.title: Good for Strong Chewer
customer_reviews.text: We buy these for our french bulldog who loves to chew (luckily not furniture or shoes). We have found this to be one of his favorite bones. They are cheap and last quite a while. Because the price is so reasonable, whenever they start getting gross we toss and replace. Would recommend, really can't beat it for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Gemma M.

customer_reviews.title: LOVE it! A must buy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these hartz Chew and Clean Tuff Bone (large size) for my two French poodles. My poodles are brothers age is 9 months old and weigh 13 lbs. We have gotten them so many chew toys and they do not last at all...but they have loved this chew toy and it has lasted! Each of them have a different color one orange and the other one green. They play with their tuff bones and they do not get tired of it. We got them at a very great price too bad I didn’t get more but I just did not think they would like it.
customer_reviews.author: Mariaelena lopez

customer_reviews.title: Not durable or safe
customer_reviews.text: The bone was destroyed by a mild chewer in a day. I was concerned and took it away when all the little plastic balls separated from the middle part. The outside is rough when chewed and picked up fibers from rugs, etc. in all, not a durable toy at all.
customer_reviews.author: Farmer chick

customer_reviews.title: Pup Knows Best
customer_reviews.text: This is very durable and my pup loves teething on this...it keeps him busy. The outside is very hard but the center is of a softer material which my pup loves. This is the only chew toy his is unable to tear up. We both are are happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Tenacity Best

customer_reviews.title: Might work for your pet
customer_reviews.text: The durability is what attracted me to this product. Unfortunately my pet doesnt care for it, she has only used it twice and shows little to no interest in using it again! Sure it will last Forever, especially now that it just sits in her play tote.
customer_reviews.author: Queen

customer_reviews.title: She can chew to her heart's content and I feel good about the product and no mess that's left
customer_reviews.text: This is the fourth Chew N' Clean I've bought. I have a Yorkie puppy about a year old who is a chewer. I will not feed my dogs rawhide or hooves. I am very careful about what they get. She gnaws on these bones. There are no splinters, no choking hazards. She can chew to her heart's content and I feel good about the product and no mess that's left.
customer_reviews.author: Tracey H.

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY THIS
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Rottie/Lab mix who is an aggressive chewer but loves Hartz bones. I have previously bought Chew n Clean bones for him and had no issue. I DO NOT recommend this bone. He had this chewed and gone within a day, beginning to consume the PLASTIC. He's a large dog and has a strong stomach so it wasn't that big of a deal, but I really DO NOT recommend this if your dog is small, doesn't have a strong stomach, or honestly, if they're an aggressive chewer. It's a waste of money. I suggest buying a Kong instead or something similar. It'll go farther.
customer_reviews.author: Frankie

customer_reviews.title: Could be a choke hazard is it actually edible.
customer_reviews.text: The whole toy is not edible and before our dogs even finished the 'edible' part they were chewing off pieces of the plastic. I think that the plastic part is in the way so the dog can't get the 'edible' part out with out chewing the plastic. I am not sure the edible part is healthy for dogs anyway. I would not recommend this product. It becomes a choke hazard. If you have a small dog that is not a strong chewer this might be okay, but still might not be a good idea.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Just okay....
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves these but they don't last very long and the dogs can't really get to the center section of the edible portion. I end up throwing it out because the end edges get too rough for anymore chewing... wasting half of what's in the chew.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Shopper

customer_reviews.title: No interest for a toy poodle. Walked away
customer_reviews.text: Took bone out of package. My toy poodle was right there. I gave it to her. She sniffed it and walked away. Has no odor and is very hard. Good for bigger dogs, but not for her. I dont think she can get her mouth around it. Lucky it was only 3.00
customer_reviews.author: Tansyn

customer_reviews.title: The plastic is chewable...
customer_reviews.text: I have three dogs who love to chew on things, I normally by deer antlers, but got these as a treat. Unfortunately they can chew the plastic and it made two of the three sick as they cannot digest the plastic so they had to throw it up. They’re very interested in the bones, but unfortunately they are just not safe for them.
customer_reviews.author: sdw81

customer_reviews.title: Plastic is too easy to chew off and eat
customer_reviews.text: My little 15lb jackapoo chewed through the plastic in no time, and ate the bits because they taste like the edible part. I even got the large so it would be harder for him to tear up. Would not recommend unless your dog is a gentle gnawer, not any level of chewer.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: They actually like these
customer_reviews.text: My dogs actually like these. I can't imagine what would attract them to chew on plastic? But they do like to chew on this occasionally. They have elk antlers and cow bones, too - so it's only one thing on the menu. I put their bones away each night, and this is always brought out. So I call it a win! It's good to my carpet and sturdy for the dogs to chew!
customer_reviews.author: Jagroo

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended...
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these for my 3 year old labs. One had big chunks of plastic chewed off his bone in minutes, the other was eating the treat portions like a champ-unfortunately he spent the night and next day puking and having diarrhea. This was the only new item he had all day...I would not recommended this and will not give my boys the 2 ball versions I bought that also have treats in them.
customer_reviews.author: Russell

customer_reviews.title: Lasts a long time, even with a heavy chewer...
customer_reviews.text: Bought one of these at the store about 5 months ago. My dog LOVES it. Found it here on Amazon for a little better price, so I ordered another. My dog is a heavy chewer and has just about obliterated the first bone, though he doesn't seem to know it's about 'done'. I'll probably be replacing it with this one in the next week or so. When it's time, I'll definitely be ordering a new one - from here!
customer_reviews.author: Yvette Diette

customer_reviews.title: Not the best option for chewers
customer_reviews.text: My dog is a chewer and in a little over an hour had this bone chewed up. She then seemed to react to the flavoring as she had bowel issues afterward. She did love the bone and the flavoring, however, due to her reaction to it as well as how quickly she was able to chew it up, I will not purchase it again.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Eubanks

customer_reviews.title: For Petite or small dogs only! Use common sense!
customer_reviews.text: These bones are for petite/small dogs only! I have a 5lb Chihuahua and he loves these bones. He spends days working on them. He is unable to break the plastic on these and I feel it is common sense that you would not give these to a larger dog or even a medium sized dog!
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Big bone
customer_reviews.text: My dog is 19 pounds. He’s still a puppy, but this thing is HUGE!! He cannot get his teeth around the whole bone. I wish I was able to actually see this in person before purchasing it. I could see him using this in about a year.
customer_reviews.author: Stefanie W.

customer_reviews.title: A great doggie chew
customer_reviews.text: I have a "chewy" dog, a shelter rescue Jack Russell-mix, and I have to keep her occupied with different toys she can play with. She jumped around when I gave her this and she settled in. It was ready to be replaced after a few days of chewing, she enjoyed it so much.
customer_reviews.author: YellowRoseTXTop Contributor: Fragrance

product_meta.title: Hartz Chew 'n Clean Bacon Flavored Dog Chew Toy
product_meta.description: Style:Tuff Bone| Size:LargeYour dog is hard-wired to chew, chew, chew. Encouraging this instinctual behavior by providing your canine companion with an appropriate chewing item can promote mental and emotional wellbeing along with dental benefits. The Hartz Chew 'n Clean Tuff Bone is a long-lasting chew toy constructed from durable materials that withstand mild to moderate chewing. The unique design boasts cleansing and tooth-scraping abilities. Enriched with a tempting bacon scent, the Tuff Bone entices dogs to exert their need to chew, while helping keep teeth and gums clean to reduce the formation of plaque and tartar. Available in a variety of sizes and colors to suit every dog's needs. Remember to supervise your pup with any toy.
feature_bullets: Satisfy your dog's natural urge to chew while promoting the dental benefits of clean teeth and general oral health
Includes a large version of our signature Tuff Bone for dogs 50-75 pounds
Constructed from durable, nylon and polyurethane with a multi-textured surface to withstand mild to moderate chewing
Features a tempting bacon scent to peak your dog's interest and deliver chewing satisfaction
Colors vary. Product chosen at random during time of shipment

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
